newsitem.title: USA: U.S. Midcontinent unleaded differentials steady.
newsitem.headline: U.S. Midcontinent unleaded differentials steady.

text.p: U.S. Midcontinent unleaded gasoline differentials were unchanged late Friday as traders began closing the books on January deliveries, traders said.
Basis drifted slightly higher during the week on support from refiner buying in the Gulf Coast and a draw in inventories in the Williams pipeline system, traders said.
The Williams pipeline system at week's end reported a 25-day supply of unleaded gasoline and 43-day supply of low sulphur diesel on hand, traders said.
Unleaded gasoline for late-January deliveries was talked 2.0/1.75 cents a gallon under NYMEX February unleaded in Group Three and 1.50/1.25 cents under the print in Chicago, traders said.
Low sulphur diesel was bid 2.50 cents a gallon under NYMEX February heating oil in Group Three and 4.0 cents a gallon under the print in Chicago.
High sulphur diesel was talked 6.25 cents a gallon under the print in Group Three and 4.75 cents under in Chicago.
